channel.title: Port Forward Problem, I think
channel.description:
Recently Epic Ancient helped me port forward
after we did, everything said the port was open and the ip was online, but she nor anyone else can connect?
picture:
[IMG]http://i33.tinypic.com/i6gsvm.png[/img] [IMG]http://i36.tinypic.com/2ut14bp.png[/img] [IMG]http://i36.tinypic.com/20uyj46.png[/img]
Can anyone tell me why nobody can connect but me? it works on my ip

item.title: Port Forward Problem, I think
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

[quote=“GrimReapersScythe, post:13, topic:307366”][quote author=Epic Ancient link=topic=403529.msg2988065#msg2988065 date=1255135894]

what do you mean by that?

He means you Ip address, your router name, and model.

She*

And no, I mean:

Your Router Administrative Username + Password.
Model Information.
The ability to get a Static IP Address (not hard… I had to do it for Mage.).
and You having the patience to let me do it via Teamviewer with some minor help from you.

But let’s not thread hijack; help the dude.
[/quote]
Sorry, didn’t know you were a girl.
Also, if you read the thread, you’ve noticed I was trying to help.[/quote]

I meant Herblore. It was getting somewhat off-topic. I know you were trying to help.

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forward Problem, I think
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

[quote=“GrimReapersScythe, post:4, topic:307366”]Make sure you portfowarded the correct port that your server is listening on. Also, make sure you have correct exceptions for the port inside your firewall settings.
Check to see what port the server is listening on by going into server.java, and searching for: public static int serverlistenerPort = . After the equals sign there are numbers. That is the port you are on. Make sure you portfowarded that port, added exceptions for that port, and make sure your client is connecting to that port.[/quote]

I made sure everything is correct. Although, not sure about the firewall… I’ll see for him. ^^"

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forward Problem, I think
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

Make sure you portfowarded the correct port that your server is listening on. Also, make sure you have correct exceptions for the port inside your firewall settings.
Check to see what port the server is listening on by going into server.java, and searching for: public static int serverlistenerPort = . After the equals sign there are numbers. That is the port you are on. Make sure you portfowarded that port, added exceptions for that port, and make sure your client is connecting to that port.

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forward Problem, I think
item.dc:creator: @magepkz magepkz
item.description:
@magepkz wrote:

jo62900:

omg i got the smae problem it wont let anyone on using my ip only lets me on using 127.0.0.1 (local host) which means no one but me can get on my server with local host so it wont activate im pissed off to

you have to port forward to stop using localhost…

Read full topic
